title: ASAS school holds High Achievers & Investiture Ceremony
content:
ISLAMABAD, Nov 1 (APP): ASAS International School, F-8 Campus, on Saturday organized its High Achievers and Investiture Ceremony to recognize academic excellence and to formally induct the newly appointed student council.

The event was graced by Professor Dr. Mukhtar Ahmed, Former Chairman of the Higher Education Commission (HEC), as the Chief Guest, said a press release.

The program commenced with the recitation of the Holy Quran and the national anthem, followed by a welcome address delivered by Saba Mubashar, Branch Head, ASAS International School F-8 Campus. She extended a warm welcome to the distinguished guests and commended the students for their dedication, discipline, and consistent performance.

In his address, Dr. Mukhtar Ahmed lauded the school’s efforts in providing a balanced educational experience that nurtures both academic achievement and moral values. He encouraged students to embrace leadership with humility, integrity, and a sense of responsibility.

Dr. Arshad Zia, Director, ASAS International School, congratulated the achievers and newly elected prefects, highlighting the institution’s continued commitment in fostering excellence, character development, and lifelong learning.

The ceremony featured award presentations to high achievers, the formal oath-taking of the student council, and cultural performances that reflected the vibrant spirit of the ASAS community.

The event concluded with a note of thanks, reaffirming ASAS International School’s vision of empowering students to become confident, responsible, and compassionate global citizens.
